message.content:
cs.DC, cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of collecting aggregate information from distributed and correlated sources, which involves distributed decision-making and communication. This suggests that the paper could belong to several sub-categories, including Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC), Information Theory (cs.IT), Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI), Systems and Control (cs.SY), and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). Among these, cs.DC is the most likely category, as the paper focuses on distributed decision-making and communication, which are key topics in this sub-category. cs.IT is also a likely category, as the paper deals with information aggregation and communication, which are central topics in information theory. cs.NI is another possible category, as the paper involves communication and networking. cs.SY and cs.AI are less likely categories, as the paper does not focus on control systems or machine learning, but they cannot be completely ruled out as the paper involves decision-making and optimization.
